item.title: Rumor: Call of Duty Could Be Crossing Over With Fallout
item.description:
Highlights

  • Modern Warfare 3 will soon have crossovers with Fallout, Gundam, and The Crow, expanding its list of collaborations.
  • These crossover events may take place in Season 4, adding new content and experiences for players to enjoy.
  • While details are scarce, the leaks hint at exciting additions to the game tied to popular franchises and upcoming movies.

A leak has teased that Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 will soon have crossovers with Fallout , Gundam , and The Crow . Call of Duty is no stranger to crossovers, having collaborated with many well-known names. It's been no different with Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 , which has added crossover content for players since its launch.

Early this year, Call of Duty players saw the announcement of a team-up between Modern Warfare 3 and The Walking Dead . Another unexpected collaboration turned Modern Warfare 3 Operators into Warhammer 40K characters through skins. For Call of Duty players and cinema fans, Modern Warfare 3 also received content from Dune: Part 2 and Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire . Modern Warfare 3 Season 3 recently began with exciting news for Call of Duty players. But a new leak has emerged, and it has good news of something that Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 may get in the future.

Related
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 Will Begin Testing Restricted Weapons in Ranked Play
Call of Duty Modern Warfare 3 Developer Treyarch Studios says that an upcoming test will add several otherwise restricted weapons to ranked play.

Dataminers have revealed that Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 will receive crossovers with Fallout , Gundam , and The Crow . Another noteworthy detail is that the crossovers may take place in Season 4, the next Modern Warfare 3 season . Twitter user CODWarfareForum released a screenshot that has been circulating on social media, showing the names of files that point to the possibility of crossover events.

Modern Warfare 3 Promises to Expand List of Call of Duty Crossovers Soon

After the Amazon Prime Video adaptation, Fallout has experienced a boost in player count across all games, even older ones like Fallout Tactics . Gundam is one of the world's most famous mecha franchises with fans from many generations. In addition to the manga and anime adaptations, Gundam has a series of games , with popular titles such as Gundam Versus and Gundam Extreme Versus Maxiboost ON . The Crow is an upcoming film starring Bill Skarsgård that adapts the famous comic book of the same name in which a murdered musician revives to avenge his death and that of his fiancée. The supposed Call of Duty crossover would be linked to the remake, which hits theaters on August 23.

There is currently no definite date for when the Modern Warfare 3 collabs with Fallout , Gundam , and The Crow will happen, nor any further details on what they will bring to the game. Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 Season 4, on the other hand, has an expected release in late spring or early summer. While fans wait for more information, the franchise shows no signs of stopping, with the reveal of the next Call of Duty potentially happening at the upcoming Xbox summer showcase.

item.title: Sonic the Hedgehog Getting 3 New LEGO Sets This Summer
item.description:
Highlights

  • Three new Sonic-themed LEGO sets coming out in August feature characters like Knuckles and Tails in exciting scenarios.
  • Fans can build scenarios like Knuckles protecting the Master Emerald and Sonic battling the nefarious Dr. Eggman in these sets.
  • One set features an 18+ complex version designed for adults, with callbacks to classic Sonic enemies and characters like Maria.

Three brand-new Sonic the Hedgehog -themed LEGO sets have been revealed, and are slated to be released later this August. Sega and LEGO previously collaborated to produce a few Sonic the Hedgehog LEGO sets in 2022, which were quite successful. This partnership continued in 2023 when five new Sonic LEGO sets were launched, which featured Sonic, Tails, and Amy. The momentum is continuing in 2024, with Sega and LEGO collaborating again on the production of three new sets.

Three new Sonic the Hedgehog LEGO sets were released this past January , based on Shadow, Knuckles, and Rouge. These sets were focused on aspects of their characters, such as Shadow riding a motorcycle on a highway and Knuckles battling against Rouge the Bat. Shortly after the release of these three sets, fans were clued into another three sets that will be released this summer. They won't need to wait too long for the next set either, as LEGO has confirmed when these sets will be released.

Related
Shadow the Hedgehog Voice Actor Reacts to Keanu Reeves Casting for Sonic 3
One of the former voice actors for Shadow the Hedgehog reacts to the casting of Keanu Reeves as the character in the upcoming Sonic 3 film.

New listings for these Sonic the Hedgehog LEGO sets were posted on the official website. They are known as the Knuckles and the Master Emerald Shrine, Tails' Adventure Boat, and Super Sonic vs. Egg Drillster. In these sets, fans can build a variety of scenarios, such as Knuckles guarding his precious Master Emerald from an Eggrobo, Tails and Sonic riding on a boat across the ocean, and Super Sonic and Shadow battling the nefarious Dr. Eggman who is using a deadly drilling robot. All three of these sets will be released on August 1.

Sonic the Hedgehog Summer LEGO Sets:

  • Tails' Adventure Boat ($54.99 USD)
  • Knuckles and the Master Emerald Shrine ($34.99 USD)
  • Super Sonic vs. Egg Drillster ($79.99 USD)

Details of these Sonic LEGO sets were leaked back in January, along with their prices. While the leaks got most of the details right, including the premises of each set and the projected release date, the prices were a little off, though much cheaper than what was initially leaked. The leak also included an unknown 18+ LEGO set, which is a more complex version of the standard LEGO set that is designed to be constructed by adults. That set will supposedly be released later in October 2024.

Many fans had already spotted some details that called back to the series' history in these sets. These include LEGO recreations of the classic Sonic the Hedgehog enemy robots like the aforementioned Eggrobo and the G.U.N. Beetle. One detail that fans especially liked was the inclusion of a portrait of Shadow the Hedgehog and Maria, the latter being an integral character of Shadow's tragic backstory . Maria and Shadow are even portrayed in the same limited style as the LEGO figures, which some fans found was a very nice touch.

item.title: Charming Stardew Valley Welcome Rug is a Sweet Housewarming Gift
item.description:
Highlights

  • Stardew Valley fans are creative and produce unique fan art inspired by the game, like the custom rug made for a brother-in-law.
  • Players can marry NPCs or other players in the game, with different paths for each option, adding depth to gameplay and relationships.
  • The indie hit Stardew Valley allows players to cultivate crops, build relationships, and explore quests in the charming world of the valley.

A Stardew Valley fan has created a welcome rug for their brother-in-law as an adorable housewarming gift. The charming Stardew Valley design is something that most fans of the game would likely be happy to receive, particularly with the special touches to the item.

Stardew Valley fans are a creative bunch and regularly produce fan art based on the game. Whether it's standard drawings, three-dimensional recreations of the Wizard's Tower and other in-game locations, or unique crafts like this one, the fanbase has found plenty of ways to show their love for the indie title.

Related
Stardew Valley Player Shows the Results of Cracking 999 Omni Geodes
A Stardew Valley player builds a massive 999 stack of Omni Geodes and then breaks them open all at once, and reveals the treasures they received.

Reddit user Gelatinoussquamish shared their creation with Stardew Valley fans, explaining that they had made it for their brother-in-law as a gift celebrating their new home. The Stardew Valley rug depicts the brother-in-law's family, featuring him, his wife, child, and two cats. Both of the adults have been customized in the Stardew Valley player character style , while the child looks like how the PC's little kids are depicted in the game. The custom coloring on the cats completes the look, with a friendly "Bienvenue" written beneath the family.

Stardew Valley fans often play the game for fun and relaxation, making this creation a charming way of combining a new family household with the joy brought by the game. While the creator didn't share whether their brother-in-law was happy with the rug, one can only hope that the creation was a delight for them to receive.

Starting a Family in Stardew Valley

While Gelatinoussquamish also didn't specify whether their brother-in-law's wife also plays the game, it's entirely possible that the couple are both enjoying the game. The indie game appeals to all kinds of people, and in Stardew Valley 's multiplayer mode , it's possible to not only marry NPCs, but PCs, as well. Some fans enjoy playing side by side with their significant other, and some even use it as a way of staying close while having a long-distance relationship. Players who want to marry another player have to go through a slightly different path than those who want to woo an NPC.

Marrying an NPC in Stardew Valley reaching a certain threshold in the relationship and then waiting for a rainy day. After that, they can pick up a Mermaid's Pendant and offer it to their loved one to propose. For player characters, fans instead need to purchase the recipe for a Wedding Ring from the traveling cart that occasionally appears south of the player's farm. The recipe only costs 500 gold, but it's a bit trickier to craft it, as it calls for five iridium bars and a prismatic shard.

item.title: Yet Another Unexpected Game is Leaving PS Plus Extra This Month
item.description:
Highlights

  • Kingdoms of Amalur: Re-Reckoning is leaving PlayStation Plus Extra in May 2024, joining 25 other titles scheduled for removal.
  • Fans were surprised and confused by the departure of Kingdoms of Amalur, as it was not listed on the Leaving Soon page for PS Plus.
  • Despite the loss of some titles, PS Plus subscribers can look forward to new additions like Ghostrunner 2 and Tunic to the extensive catalog.

Kingdoms of Amalur: Re-Reckoning is set to leave PlayStation Plus ' Extra tier catalog within the month of May 2024. The remake of developer Big Huge Games' classic action RPG will soon depart from the PlayStation Plus library in addition to the 25 titles already scheduled to disappear from the service throughout the coming weeks.

Many fans were saddened when the PlayStation Plus catalog revealed it was saying goodbye to a variety of beloved games from its Extra and Essential collections, which included several beloved classic JRPG titles. Previous reports additionally noted Guerrilla Games' formerly PlayStation-exclusive title Horizon Zero Dawn is also leaving the PS Plus lineup by May 21, which surprised many fans who were familiar with the series and the level of support it received from publisher and PlayStation manufacturer Sony. Unfortunately for PlayStation owners, it seems another beloved game will be bidding farewell to the PS Plus catalog.

10:34
Related
The Best Games On PlayStation Plus Extra & Premium (April 2024)
PS Plus Extra and Premium have some of the best PlayStation games from across the console brand's history.

Online users noticed the PlayStation store page for Kingdoms of Amalur: Re-Reckoning contained a message stating that developer Kaiko's remaster of the beloved action RPG would be leaving PlayStation Plus Premium. Reddit user Inevitable-Middle412 shared a picture of the Kingdoms of Amalur: Re-Reckoning store page on the PlayStation Plus subreddit, which seemingly confirmed the game would be dropped from the service by May 21. However, several commenters pointed out that Kingdoms of Amalur was notably not one of the titles included in the Leaving Soon page for PlayStation Plus , which further confused fans and left some users wondering if this might have been a mistake.

Kingdoms of Amalur: Re-Reckoning is Leaving PlayStation Plus Extra

While many fans were saddened to hear that the May 2024 PS Plus catalog will no longer offer Kingdoms of Amalur , some fans were also confused about why the game was not included in the list of 25 games scheduled to leave PS Plus. Some fans were annoyed with the omission, with users asking why they didn't hear the news from the official PS Plus page. Others further criticized Sony for its failure to keep its subscribers aware of the upcoming loss and suggested that the company needed to find a way to keep its users up to date.

Though PlayStation Plus is scheduled to bid farewell to over two dozen titles within the span of three short weeks, it's not all bad news for users of the service. PlayStation previously announced subscribers will see new titles enter the lineup to replenish its losses, with games such as Ghostrunner 2 and Tunic joining PS Plus ' sizable catalog. The PlayStation Plus library additionally boasts over 400 titles in its library, meaning subscribers are still spoiled for choice when it comes to choosing their next video game.

item.title: 8 New Super Mario Bros. LEGO Sets Are Coming Later This Year
item.description:
Highlights

  • Super Mario and LEGO collab sets releasing August 1, including interactive figures and iconic levels like Bowser's Train.
  • New sets include Adventures with LEGO Mario, Luigi, Peach, Goombas' Playground, and more themed after Super Mario levels.
  • LEGO also working on Animal Crossing sets.

Super Mario Bros. and LEGO have revealed eight brand-new collaboration sets based on the popular Nintendo property, which will all be available to purchase on August 1. Nintendo has collaborated with LEGO on a number of its properties, including the Super Mario Bros. franchise. Ever since their introduction in 2020, Nintendo and LEGO have partnered on a number of occasions to bring the franchise to life in LEGO form. This includes a number of playsets and figures based on popular Super Mario levels and characters.

One of the most recent sets announced was the LEGO Super Mario Kart set , which was revealed during MAR10 Day. This set wasn't shown in detail and was briefly showcased. However, LEGO did give a brief demonstration and look at some of the sets that would release later in 2024, including one based on Bowser's Train from Super Mario 3D World and a battle with Roy the Koopaling at Peach's Castle. While a release date wasn't confirmed then, LEGO has revealed the release date for these sets, along with a number of other sets that will release on the same day.

Related
Teenager Finds Rare LEGO Figure That's Been Missing for 27 Years
A teenager finds a rare LEGO minifigure that has been lost at sea for the past 27 years during a seemingly normal fishing trip with their parents.

These eight sets are Adventures with Interactive LEGO Mario, Adventures with Interactive LEGO Luigi, Adventures with Interactive LEGO Peach, Soda Jungle Maker Set, Goombas' Playground, The Bowser Express Train, King Boo's Haunted Mansion, and Battle with Roy at Peach's Castle. All of these Super Mario -themed LEGO sets will be released on August 1. Some of these sets include the interactive Mario character LEGO figures , which include voice lines for Mario, Luigi, and Peach, much like the starter course sets, but on a smaller scale.

Confirmed Super Mario Bros. Sets Releasing in August:

  • Adventures with Interactive LEGO Mario
  • Adventures with Interactive LEGO Luigi
  • Adventures with Interactive LEGO Peach
  • Soda Jungle Maker Set
  • Goombas' Playground
  • The Bowser Express Train
  • King Boo’s Haunted Mansion
  • Battle with Roy at Peach's Castle

Alongside the three sets that include interactive figures of the heroic characters, the other five sets are based on different Super Mario Bros. level themes and characters, such as a set of Goombas having fun by themselves, a huge set based on the lush Soda Jungle from the New Super Mario Bros. games, and even a level set featuring King Boo. All of these LEGO sets should be fun ways for fans to create new levels or adventures with their existing sets.

LEGO isn't just collaborating with Nintendo on Super Mario Bros. themed sets, as LEGO sets based on Animal Crossing were confirmed to also be released later this August. These sets are based on popular Animal Crossing locales and characters, such as a concert with K.K. Slider at the Town Hall or Dodo Airlines. With the Super Mario Kart LEGO set releasing in 2025, these eight sets could help tide fans over until then.
